      • probability

        public static double probability​(MDD mdd,
                                 MapOf<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Double>[] P,
                                 int precision,
                                 boolean ceil)
        Given a MDD and a map associating labels to probabilities (by layer), compute the probability of the whole MDD.
        Parameters:
        mdd - The MDD
        P - The associations labels â†’ probabilities
        precision - The precision of the probabilities
        ceil - true if the rounding must be ceil, false if floor
        Returns:
        The probability of the MDD

      • upperbound

        public static long upperbound​(StochasticVariable[] X,
                              int pivotPos,
                              long threshold,
                              long maxQuantity,
                              int precision)
        Return the maximum quantity of flow that can be put in pivot without going below the threshold. The array X should be ordered by non increasing cost.
        Parameters:
        X - The array of StochasticVariable ordered by non increasing cost
        pivotPos - The position of the pivot in the array X.
        threshold - The threshold we want to be ABOVE
        maxQuantity - The maximum quantity we can put
        precision - The precision used for the variables
        Returns:
        The maximum quantity of flow that can be put in pivot without going below the threshold.

      • upperboundMin

        public static long upperboundMin​(StochasticVariable[] X,
                                 int pivotPos,
                                 long threshold,
                                 long maxQuantity,
                                 int precision)
        Return the maximum quantity of flow that can be put in pivot without exceeding the threshold. The array X should be ordered by non increasing cost
        Parameters:
        X - The array of StochasticVariable order by non increasing cost
        pivotPos - The position of the pivot in the array
        threshold - The threshold we want to be BELOW
        maxQuantity - The maximum quantity we can put
        precision - The precision used for the variables
        Returns:
        The maximum quantity of flow that can be put in pivot without exceeding the threshold.

      • lowerbound

        public static long lowerbound​(StochasticVariable[] X,
                              int pivotPos,
                              long threshold,
                              long maxQuantity,
                              int precision)
        Return the minimum quantity of flow that can be put in pivot without going below the threshold. The array X should be ordered by non increasing cost.
        Parameters:
        X - The array of StochasticVariable ordered by non increasing cost
        pivotPos - The position of the pivot in the array X.
        threshold - The threshold we want to be ABOVE
        maxQuantity - The maximum quantity we can put
        precision - The precision used for the variables
        Returns:
        The minimum quantity of flow that can be put in pivot without going below the threshold.

      • computeBounds

        public static long[][] computeBounds​(StochasticVariable[] X,
                                     long minThreshold,
                                     long maxThreshold,
                                     int precision)
        Compute all bounds of the StochasticVariables in X in a way that we respect the two thresholds.
        Parameters:
        X - The array of StochasticVariable ordered by non increasing cost
        minThreshold - The minimum threshold value
        maxThreshold - The maximum threshold value
        precision - The precision of the variables
        Returns:
        The bounds respecting both thresholds.

      • upperboundAll

        public static long upperboundAll​(StochasticVariable[] X,
                                 long[][] bounds,
                                 long threshold,
                                 long totalQuantity,
                                 int precision)
        Compute all upperbounds of the variables in X in linear time. This algorithm doesn't use a pivot.
        Parameters:
        X - The array of StochasticVariable ordered by non increasing cost
        bounds - The array containing all current bounds of variables in X (that will be updated)
        threshold - The minimum threshold value
        totalQuantity - The total amount of quantity we can put
        precision - The precision of the variables
        Returns:
        The upperbounds respecting the given threshold.

        public static long lowerboundAll​(StochasticVariable[] X,
                                 long[][] bounds,
                                 long threshold,
                                 long totalQuantity,
                                 int precision)
